member.remarks: 'Sender' field is not required if 'From' property contains only one . 'Sender' property is filled when message is from more than one person ('From' contains more than one mailbox). member.summary: "\Inbox" flag used by XLIST command.

member.summary: "\Spam" flag used by XLIST command.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.XStarred
member.summary: "\Starred" flag used by XLIST command.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.All
member.summary: This folder presents all messages in the user's message store (\All). Implementations MAY omit some messages, such as, perhaps, those in \Trash and \Junk. When this special use is supported, it is almost certain to represent a virtual folder.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Archive
member.summary: This folder is used to archive messages (\Archive). The meaning of an "archival" folder is server-dependent; typically, it will be used to get messages out of the inbox, or otherwise keep them out of the user's way, while still making them accessible.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Drafts
member.summary: This folder is used to hold draft messages - typically, messages that are being composed but have not yet been sent (\Drafts). In some server implementations, this might be a virtual folder, containing messages from other folders that are marked with the message flag. Alternatively, this might just be advice that a client put drafts here.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Flagged
member.summary: This folder presents all messages marked in some way as "important" (\Flagged). When this special use is supported, it is likely to represent a virtual folder collecting messages (from other folders) that are marked with the "\Flagged" message flag.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Junk
member.summary: This folder is where messages deemed to be junk mail are held (\Junk). Some server implementations might put messages here automatically. Alternatively, this might just be advice to a client-side spam filter.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Sent
member.summary: This folder is used to hold copies of messages that have been sent (\Sent). Some server implementations might put messages here automatically. Alternatively, this might just be advice that a client save sent messages here.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Trash
member.summary: This folder is used to hold messages that have been deleted or marked for deletion (\Trash). In some server implementations, this might be a virtual folder, containing messages from other folders.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.HasChildren
member.summary: The presence of this attribute indicates that the folder has child folders that are accessible to the user (\HasChildren).

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.HasNoChildren
member.summary: The presence of this attribute indicates that the folder has NO child mailboxes that are accessible to the user. If a folder has the attribute, the attribute is redundant and SHOULD be omitted. (\HasNoChildren).

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.NoInferiors
member.summary: It is not possible for any child levels of hierarchy to exist under this name; no child levels exist now and none can be created in the future (\Noinferiors). This flag also implies .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.NoSelect
member.summary: It is not possible to use this name as a selectable folder (\Noselect).

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.NonExistent
member.summary: Indicates that a folder name does not refer to an existing mailbox (\NonExistent). This flag also implies .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Remote
member.summary: Indicates that a folder is remote folder. (\Remote).

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderFlag.Subscribed
member.summary: Indicates that a folder is subscribed. (\Subscribed).

member.name: T:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.ThreadMethod
member.summary: Represents threading method supported by the remote server. You can use method to obtain the list of all methods supported by the remote server.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.ThreadMethod.OrderedSubject
member.summary: Represemtes THREAD=ORDEREDSUBJECT threading method.
member.remarks:
The ORDEREDSUBJECT threading algorithm is also referred to as "poor man's threading". The searched messages are sorted by base subject and then by the sent date. The messages are then split into separate threads, with each thread containing messages with the same base subject text. Finally, the threads are sorted by the sent date of the first message in the thread.
The top level or "root" in ORDEREDSUBJECT threading contains the first message of every thread. All messages in the root are siblings of each other. The second message of a thread is the child of the first message, and subsequent messages of the thread are siblings of the second message and hence children of the message at the root. Hence, there are no grandchildren in ORDEREDSUBJECT threading.
Children in ORDEREDSUBJECT threading do not have descendants. Client implementations SHOULD treat descendants of a child in a server response as being siblings of that child.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.ThreadMethod.References
member.summary: Represemtes THREAD=REFERENCES threading method.
member.remarks: The REFERENCES threading algorithm threads the searched messages by grouping them together in parent/child relationships based on which messages are replies to others. The parent/child relationships are built using two methods: reconstructing a message's ancestry using the references contained within it; and checking the original (not base) subject of a message to see if it is a reply to (or forward of) another message.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.ThreadMethod.ChooseBest(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Limilabs.Client.IMAP.ThreadMethod})
member.summary: Chooses best threading method available. Returns null when no method is available.
member.returns: Best threading method or null when no method is available.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Status.UIDNext
member.summary:
UIDNEXT: The next unique identifier value. The next unique identifier value is the predicted value that will be assigned to a new message in the mailbox. Unless the unique identifier validity () also changes , the next unique identifier value MUST NOT change unless new messages are added to the mailbox; and the next unique identifier value MUST change whenever new messages are added to the mailbox, even if those new messages are subsequently deleted.
The next unique identifier value is intended to provide a means for a client to determine whether any messages have been delivered to the mailbox since the previous time it checked this value.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Status.UIDValidity
member.summary:
UIDVALIDITY: The unique identifier validity value.
Any change of unique identifiers between sessions MUST be detectable using the change of UIDVALIDITY. If unique identifiers from an earlier session fail to persist in this session, the UIDVALIDITY value MUST be greater than the one used in the earlier session.

member.summary: Represents expressions that can be used by methods. To join several sort criteria use .

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.SortBy.Reverse(Limilabs.Client.IMAP.ISorter)
member.summary: Reverses specified sorter. Descending order is used. Note: REVERSE only reverses a single criterion, and does not affect the implicit "sequence number" sort criterion if all other criteria are identical. Consequently, a sort of REVERSE SUBJECT is not the same as a reverse ordering of a SUBJECT sort. This can be avoided by use of additional criteria, e.g., SUBJECT DATE vs. REVERSE SUBJECT REVERSE DATE. In general, however, it's better (and faster, if the client has a "reverse current ordering" command) to reverse the results in the client instead of issuing a new SORT.

member.summary: Returns multiple sort criteria.

member.summary: Represents flag used by IMAP protocol to mark email messages. Static fields represent most common, system flags. You can use and to set or remove a flag.
member.remarks: Exchange 2007 and 2010 do not support custom flags (keywords).

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.All
member.summary: Gets \ALL flag. It repesents all messages in the mailbox.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Seen
member.summary: Gets \SEEN flag. Message has been read.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.New
member.summary: Gets \NEW flag. It represents messages that have the flag set but not the flag. This is functionally equivalent to "(\RECENT \UNSEEN)".

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Recent
member.summary: Gets \RECENT flag (don't confuse it with ). Message is "recently" arrived in this mailbox.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Old
member.summary: Gets \OLD flag. It represents messages that do not have the flag set. This is functionally equivalent to "NOT \RECENT" (as opposed to "NOT \NEW").

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Draft
member.summary: Gets \DRAFT flag. Message has not completed composition (marked as a draft).

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Deleted
member.summary: Gets \DELETED flag. Message is "deleted" for removal by later EXPUNGE.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Flagged
member.summary: Gets \FLAGGED flag. Message is "flagged" for urgent/special attention.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Forwarded
member.summary: Gets the keyword that specifies that the message was resent to another email address, embedded within or attached to a new message. This keyword is set by the mail client when it successfully forwards the message to another email address.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.SubmitPending
member.summary: Gets the keyword that designates the message as awaiting to be submitted. This keyword allows storing messages waiting to be submitted in the same mailbox where messages that were already submitted and/or are being edited are stored.
member.remarks: A message that has both $Submitted and $SubmitPending IMAP keywords set is a message being actively submitted.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Flag.Submitted
member.summary: Gets the keyword that designates the message as being sent out.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.Larger(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with an [RFC-2822] size larger than the specified number of octets.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.Smaller(System.Int64)

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.On(System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Creates criterion to find messages whose internal date (disregarding time and timezone) is within the specified date.
In other words, "ON 13-APR-2000" means messages with an INTERNALDATE text which starts with "13-APR-2000", even if timezone differential from the local timezone is sufficient to move that INTERNALDATE into the previous or next day.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.SentOn(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages whose [RFC-2822] Date: header (disregarding time and timezone) is within the specified date.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.Before(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages whose internal date (disregarding time and timezone), assigned by an IMAP server, is earlier than the specified date.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.SentBefore(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages whose [RFC-2822] Date: header (disregarding time and timezone) is earlier than the specified date.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.Since(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages whose internal date (disregarding time and timezone), assigned by an IMAP server, is within or later than the specified date.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.SentSince(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages whose [RFC-2822] Date: header (disregarding time and timezone) is within or later than the specified date.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.Header(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages that have a header with the specified field-name (as defined in [RFC-2822]) and that contains the specified string in the text of the header (what comes after the colon). If the string to search is zero-length, this matches all messages that have a header line with the specified field-name regardless of the contents.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.HasHeader(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages that have specified header.
member.remarks: Does not work with Exchange server.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.HasKeyword(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with the specified keyword flag set.
member.remarks: Exchange 2007 and 2010 do not support custom flags (keywords).

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.GmailMessageId(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with specified Gmail message id (X-GM-MSGID). This method can be used only if server advertises extension support.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.GmailMessageId(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with specified Gmail message id (X-GM-MSGID). This method can be used only if server advertises extension support.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.GmailThreadId(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with specified Gmail thread id (X-GM-THRID). This method can be used only if server advertises extension support.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.GmailThreadId(System.Decimal)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with specified Gmail thread id (X-GM-THRID). This method can be used only if server advertises extension support.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.GmailRawSearch(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with specified Gmail thread id (X-GM-THRID). This method can be used only if server advertises extension support.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.GmailLabel(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages with specified Gmail label (X-GM-LABELS). This method can be used only if server advertises extension support.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Expression.MessageId(System.String)
member.summary: Creates criterion to find messages, that have a message-id header, that contains specified value (contains the specified string in the text of the header). If the string to search is zero-length, this matches all messages that have a Message-ID header name regardless of the contents.
member.remarks:
Some servers (Yahoo) require the search argument to be in exactly the same format, as the email header value. It's incorrect behavior, but there is a workaround for it: you can use collection:
IMail email = ... Expression.MessageId(email.Headers["Message-ID"])

member.summary: Logs user in using best method available. When no AUTH capability is found, this method switches to SSL () and tries again.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Login(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs user in using LOGIN command. When LOGIN command is disabled by including the LOGINDISABLED capability this method tries to log-in using . Unless SSL connection is used this method sends the password in clear text. You can check which authentication methods remote server supports using method.

member.summary: Sends PROXYAUTH command. Allows an authorised administrator to proxy into any user's mailbox. PROXYAUTH is not a standard IMAP command and your server may reject it. You can try in such case.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.SelectInbox
member.summary: Selects 'INBOX' as a current folder (mailbox) so that messages inside can be accessed. Select command will remove the flag since the folder has now been viewed (This is not the same as the IMAP flag).
member.returns: Status of the folder (mailbox). It can be updated by subsequent commands or other commands.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Select(System.String)
member.summary: Selects specified folder (mailbox) as the current folder so that messages inside can be accessed. Select command will remove the flag since the folder has now been viewed (This is not the same as the IMAP flag).
member.remarks: IMAP servers may differ in the separator character used in folder hierarchy paths. Common separator chars are '.' and '/'. For example: "Inbox/Folder" or "Inbox.Folder".
member.returns: Status of the folder (mailbox). It can be updated by subsequent or other commands.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Select(Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderInfo)
member.summary: Selects specified folder (mailbox) as the current folder so that messages inside can be accessed. Select command will remove the flag since the folder has now been viewed (This is not the same as the IMAP flag).
member.remarks: If folder.Flags contain this method invokes method.
member.returns: Status of the folder (mailbox). It can be updated by subsequent or other commands.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.ExamineInbox
member.summary: Selects 'INBOX' as a current read-only folder (mailbox) so that messages inside can be accessed. Examine command will not reset the flag

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Examine(System.String)
member.summary: Selects specified folder (mailbox) as the current read-only folder so that messages inside can be accessed. Examine command will not reset the flag
member.remarks: IMAP servers may differ in the separator character used in folder hierarchy paths. Common separator chars are '.' and '/'. For example: "Inbox/Folder" or "Inbox.Folder".

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Examine(Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderInfo)
member.summary: Selects specified folder (mailbox) as the current read-only folder so that messages inside can be accessed. Examine command will not reset the flag.
member.remarks: If folder.Flags contain this method invokes .

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Status(Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderInfo)
member.summary: The STATUS command requests the status of the indicated mailbox. It does not change the currently selected mailbox, nor does it affect the state of any messages in the queried mailbox (messages don't lose the ) flag. This command MUST NOT be used as a "check for new messages in the selected mailbox" operation (You should rather use and or ) or ). STATUS command is not guaranteed to be fast in its response.
member.returns: Status information of the specified folder.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.Status(System.String)
member.summary: The STATUS command requests the status of the indicated mailbox. It does not change the currently selected mailbox, nor does it affect the state of any messages in the queried mailbox (messages don't lose the ) flag. This command MUST NOT be used as a "check for new messages in the selected mailbox" operation (You should rather use and or ) or ). STATUS command is not guaranteed to be fast in its response.
member.returns: Status information of the specified folder.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.CloseCurrentFolder
member.summary: Issues CLOSE command to the server. Unless Examine was used to open folder, CLOSE command permanently removes all messages that have the flag set from the currently selected folder, and returns to the authenticated state from the selected state (no folder is selected).

Flag to be added. For specifying system flags you can use static fields e.g. .

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.CopyByUID(System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary: Copies the specified message to the specified destination folder (mailbox).
member.remarks: IMAP servers may differ in the separator character used in folder hierarchy paths. Common separator chars are '.' and '/'. For example: "Inbox/Folder" or "Inbox.Folder".
member.returns: Newly assigned unique-id (UID) of the copied message, if the server supports , null otherwise.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.DeleteFolder(Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderInfo)
member.summary: Permanently removes a folder (mailbox) with the given name.
member.remarks:
IMAP servers may differ in the separator character used in folder hierarchy paths. Common separator chars are '.' and '/'. For example: "Inbox/Folder" or "Inbox.Folder".
The DELETE command MUST NOT remove inferior hierarchical names. For example, if a mailbox "foo" has an inferior "foo.bar" (assuming "." is the hierarchy delimiter character), removing "foo" MUST NOT remove "foo.bar".
It is an error to attempt to delete a name that has inferior hierarchical names and also has the \Noselect mailbox name attribute.
It is permitted to delete a name that has inferior hierarchical names and does not have the \Noselect mailbox name attribute. In this case, all messages in that mailbox are removed, and the name will acquire the \Noselect mailbox name attribute.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.Imap.DeleteFolder(System.String)
member.summary: Permanently removes a folder (mailbox) with the given name.
member.remarks:
IMAP servers may differ in the separator character used in folder hierarchy paths. Common separator chars are '.' and '/'. For example: "Inbox/Folder" or "Inbox.Folder".
The DELETE command MUST NOT remove inferior hierarchical names. For example, if a mailbox "foo" has an inferior "foo.bar" (assuming "." is the hierarchy delimiter character), removing "foo" MUST NOT remove "foo.bar".
It is an error to attempt to delete a name that has inferior hierarchical names and also has the \Noselect mailbox name attribute.
It is permitted to delete a name that has inferior hierarchical names and does not have the \Noselect mailbox name attribute. In this case, all messages in that mailbox are removed, and the name will acquire the \Noselect mailbox name attribute.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.UIDValidity
member.summary:
Gets the unique identifier validity value.
Any change of unique identifiers between sessions MUST be detectable using the change of UIDVALIDITY. If unique identifiers from an earlier session fail to persist in this session, the UIDVALIDITY value MUST be greater than the one used in the earlier session.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.UIDNext
member.summary:
Gets the next unique identifier value.
The next unique identifier value is the predicted value that will be assigned to a new message in the folder (mailbox). Unless the unique identifier validity () also changes , the next unique identifier value MUST NOT change unless new messages are added to the mailbox; and the next unique identifier value MUST change whenever new messages are added to the mailbox, even if those new messages are subsequently deleted.
The next unique identifier value is intended to provide a means for a client to determine whether any messages have been delivered to the mailbox since the previous time it checked this value.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.FirstUnseenMessageNumber
member.summary: Gets the message sequence number of the first unseen message in the folder (OK [UNSEEN <n>]) If it's null client can not make any assumptions about the first unseen message, and needs to issue a with if it wants to find it.

member.summary: Gets the list of the known flags that can be change permanently.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.AllFlagsArePermanent
member.summary: Gets boolean value indicating if all flags are permanent (no PERMANENTFLAGS response received from the IMAP server).

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.Alerts
member.summary: Gets the list of server alerts (indicated by [ALERT] keyword).

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.Throttled
member.summary: Gets the value indicating that requests are being throttled. In this case, your application should back off and perform fewer requests for that user.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Client.IMAP.FolderStatus.UIDNotSticky
member.summary: The selected mailbox is supported by a mail store that does not support persistent UIDs; that is, UIDVALIDITY will be different each time the mailbox is selected. Consequently, APPEND or COPY to this mailbox will not return an APPENDUID or COPYUID response code.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Client.POP3.Pop3.LoginAPOP(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Logs user in using APOP command. This method does NOT send the password in clear text.
member.remarks: APOP is optional command and a POP3 server does NOT need to support it. A POP3 server which implements the APOP command will include a timestamp in its banner greeting. Check property in order to know if server included the timestamp. Some servers include timestamp, but do NOT support APOP command. This command is unnecessary if you are using SSL, use method instead.

member.summary: CHUNKING extension. Allows sending message in chunks, without SMTP's \r\n.->\r\n.. conversion, which improves memory usage. (RFC 3030)

member.name: F:Limilabs.Client.SMTP.SmtpExtension.SmtpUTF8
member.summary: UTF8SMTP extension. Allows usage of UTF-8 email addresses (both local and domain part) without any encoding. must be announced by the server when this extension is announced. BODY=8BITMIME or BODY=BINARYMIME must be used by the client if SMTPUTF8 extension is used. (RFC 6531)

member.summary: Represents SMTP SIZE extension.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Client.Authentication.SSPIException
member.summary: Represents SSPI exception.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Client.Authentication.SSPIMechanism
member.summary: Represents SSPI mechanism.
member.remarks:
SSPI authentication methods (NTLM, Kerberos, Negotiate) can work in two modes:
1. The user specifies their credentials explicitly (like other authentication methods work), and authentication token is created from them.
2. Integrated Windows Authentication (IWA). The authentication token is created by Windows from the credentials of the currently logged Windows user. The application never deals with the account password. IWA mode provides increased security and spares the end user from entering their credentials.
IWA, however, cannot be used when the currently logged Windows user is not an interactive user.
In web applications, you often deal with system users (like NETWORK SERVICE, ASPNET, etc). To be able to use IWA in an ASP.NET application, the application itself must run under the context of an interactive user (<authentication mode="Windows"/> in web.config).
Also, the user from whose context the authentication token is constructed, must have a valid mailbox on the e-mail server. This is important as even if the given user is registered in the Active Directory and can log in the domain, it does not necessarily mean that the system has already provisioned their mailbox.

member.summary: Gets or sets 'Content-Transfer-Encoding' of the data. This object provides information on how the data was encoded for transport purposes.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MIME.MimeData.XTnef2MimeRenderingPosition
member.summary: Gets X-Tnef2Mime-RenderingPosition header value. This header is filled by TNEF to MIME parser with PR_RENDERING_POSITION MAPI value. It indicates where in the message text the attachment should be rendered (in characters).
member.remarks: This property should not be used with Rich Text Format (RTF) text. The rendering position is indicated in RTF by an escape sequence called the object attachment placeholder. This sequence consists of the string \objattph followed by a single character, normally a space, that will be replaced by the attachment rendering.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MIME.MimeData.XRtfRenderingPosition
member.summary: Gets X-Rtf-RenderingPosition header value. This header is filled by TNEF to MIME with PR_RENDERING_POSITION MAPI value or by MSG to MIME parser. It indicates where in the message text the attachment should be rendered (in characters).
member.remarks: This property should not be used with Rich Text Format (RTF) text. The rendering position is indicated in RTF by an escape sequence called the object attachment placeholder. This sequence consists of the string \objattph followed by a single character, normally a space, that will be replaced by the attachment rendering.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Mail.MIME.MimeSigned.CheckSignature(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies the digital signatures on the signed CMS/PKCS #7 message and, optionally, validates the signers' certificates.
member.param: : A System.Boolean value that specifies whether only the digital signatures are verified without the signers' certificates being validated. If is true, only the digital signatures are verified. If it is false, the digital signatures are verified, the signers' certificates are validated, and the purposes of the certificates are validated. The purposes of a certificate are considered valid if the certificate has no key usage or if the key usage supports digital signatures or non-repudiation.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurrenceId
member.summary:
Represents "RECURRENCE-ID" property (). The full range of calendar components specified by a recurrence set is referenced by referring to just the property value corresponding to the calendar component. The "RECURRENCE-ID" property allows the reference to an individual instance within the recurrence set.
The "RECURRENCE-ID" property is used in conjunction with the and property to identify a particular instance of a recurring event. For a given pair of and property values, the "RECURRENCE-ID" value for a recurrence instance is fixed.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurrenceId.Range
member.summary: The "RANGE" parameter is used to specify the effective range of recurrence instances from the instance specified by the "RECURRENCE-ID" property value. The default value for the range parameter (when it's null) is the single recurrence instance only. The value can also be and .

member.summary: Gets the time zone. (TZID).

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurrenceId.DateOnly
member.summary: Indicates
member.remarks: If the value of the property is a DATE type value, then the value MUST be the calendar date for the recurrence instance.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurrenceId.Value
member.summary: Gets the time when recurrence instance would occur.
member.remarks: The date/time value is set to the time when the original recurrence instance would occur; meaning that if the intent is to change a Friday meeting to Thursday, the date/time is still set to the original Friday meeting.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurringRule.ByWeekNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets BYWEEKNO parameter. List of values ranging from 1 to 53 or -53 to -1. A week is defined as a seven day period, starting on the day of the week defined to be the week start (). Week number one of the calendar year is the first week which contains at least four (4) days in that calendar year. This rule part is only valid for YEARLY rules. For example, 3 represents the third week of the year.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurringRule.ByYearDay
member.summary: Gets or sets BYYEARDAY parameter. List of values ranging from -365 to 365.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurringRule.ByMonthDay
member.summary: Gets or sets BYMONTHDAY parameter. List of values ranging from -31 to 31.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurringRule.BySetPos
member.summary: Gets or sets BYSETPOS parameter. Specifies list of values which corresponds to the nth occurrence within the set of events specified by the rule. Valid values are 1 to 366 or -366 to -1. It MUST only be used in conjunction with another BYxxx rule part. For example "the last work day of the month" could be represented as: RRULE:FREQ=MONTHLY;BYDAY=MO,TU,WE,TH,FR;BYSETPOS=-1

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Appointments.RecurringRule.WorkweekStarts
member.summary: Gets or sets WKST parameter. The WKST rule part specifies the day on which the workweek starts. This is significant when a WEEKLY RRULE has an interval greater than 1, and a BYDAY rule part is specified. This is also significant when in a YEARLY RRULE when a BYWEEKNO rule part is specified. The default value is MO.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonActionMode
member.summary: Specifies if the disposition described by the disposition type was a result of an manual or automatic action. You can use static fields of this class: , .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonActionMode.ManualAction
member.summary: The disposition described by the disposition type was a result of an explicit instruction by the user rather than some sort of automatically performed action.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonActionMode.AutomaticAction
member.summary: The disposition described by the disposition type was a result of an automatic action, rather than an explicit instruction by the user for this message.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonSendingMode
member.summary: Specifies if the Message Delivery Notification (MDN) was sent manually or automatically. You can use static fields of this class: , .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonSendingMode.SentManually
member.summary: The user explicitly gave permission for this particular Message Delivery Notification (MDN) to be sent.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonSendingMode.SentAutomatically
member.summary: The Message Delivery Notification (MDN) was sent because the Mail User Agent (MUA) had previously been configured to do so automatically.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType
member.summary: Describes disposition type of the message (RFC 2298, RFC 3798) You can use static fields of this class: , .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType.Displayed
member.summary: The message has been displayed by the Mail User Agent (MUA) to someone reading the recipient's mailbox. There is no guarantee that the content has been read or understood.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType.Deleted
member.summary: The message has been deleted. The recipient may or may not have seen the message. The recipient might "undelete" the message at a later time and read the message.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType.Dispatched
member.summary: The message has been sent somewhere in some manner (e.g., printed, faxed, forwarded) without necessarily having been previously displayed to the user. The user may or may not see the message later.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType.Processed
member.summary: The message has been processed in some manner (i.e., by some sort of rules or server) without being displayed to the user. The user mayor may not see the message later, or there may not even be a human user associated with the mailbox.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType.Denied
member.summary: The recipient does not wish the sender to be informed of the message's disposition. A UA may also siliently ignore message disposition requests in this situation.
member.remarks: (Removed by RFC 3798 "reflecting the lack of implementation or usage at this time.")

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DispositonType.Failed
member.summary: A failure occurred that prevented the proper generation of an MDN. More information about the cause of the failure may be contained in a Failure field. The "failed" disposition type is not to be used for the situation in which there is is some problem in processing the message other than interpreting the request for an MDN. The "processed" or other disposition type with appropriate disposition modifiers is to be used in such situations.
member.remarks: (Removed by RFC 3798 "reflecting the lack of implementation or usage at this time.")

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.HeaderDecoder
member.summary: Implements 'Base64' and 'Quoted-Printable' header decoding (RFC 2047), removes comments and replaces escape sequences.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.HeaderDecoder.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes Base64 and Quoted-Printable strings (RFC 2047).
member.exception: The charset is not supported by the current regional options of the computer executing this method.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DSNAction
member.summary: Indicates the action performed by the Reporting-MTA as a result of its attempt to deliver the message. You can use static fields of this class: , , , , .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DSNAction.Failed
member.summary: Indicates that the message could not be delivered to the recipient. The Reporting MTA has abandoned any attempts to deliver the message to this recipient. No further notifications should be expected.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DSNAction.Delayed
member.summary: Indicates that the Reporting MTA has so far been unable to deliver or relay the message, but it will continue to attempt to do so. Additional notification messages may be issued as the message is further delayed or successfully delivered, or if delivery attempts are later abandoned.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DSNAction.Delivered
member.summary: Indicates that the message was successfully delivered to the recipient address specified by the sender, which includes "delivery" to a mailing list exploder. It does not indicate that the message has been read. This is a terminal state and no further DSN for this recipient should be expected.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DSNAction.Relayed
member.summary: Indicates that the message has been relayed or gatewayed into an environment that does not accept responsibility for generating DSNs upon successful delivery. This action-value SHOULD NOT be used unless the sender has requested notification of successful delivery for this recipient.

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.DSNAction.Expanded
member.summary: Indicates that the message has been successfully delivered to the recipient address as specified by the sender, and forwarded by the Reporting-MTA beyond that destination to multiple additional recipient addresses. An action-value of "expanded" differs from in that "expanded" is not a terminal state. Further "failed" and/or "delayed" notifications may be provided.

member.summary: Mime encoding format. You can use static fields of this class: , , , .

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.MimeEncoding.Bit7
member.summary: No encoding transformation has been performed. 7-bit encoding refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (0). CR (13) and LF (10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences. (RFC 2045 2.7)

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.MimeEncoding.Bit8
member.summary: No encoding transformation has been performed. 8-bit encoding refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (0). CR (13) and LF (10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences. (RFC 2045 2.7)

member.name: F:Limilabs.Mail.Headers.MimeEncoding.Binary
member.summary: No encoding transformation has been performed. Binary encoding refers to data where any sequence of octets whatsoever is allowed. (RFC 2045 2.7)

member.summary: Represents quoted-printable encoding.

member.summary: Gets or sets the signature expiration - the time that this signature was created (x=). Default (null) is an unknown expiration time. The value of this property must be greater than the value of if both are present. Signatures MAY be considered invalid if the verification time at the verifier is past the expiration date.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.SignatureValidationConfiguration.VerifySignatureOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether only the digital signatures are verified without the signers' certificates being validated. If set to true, only the digital signatures are verified. If set to false, the digital signatures are verified, the signers' certificates are validated, and the purposes of the certificates are validated. The purposes of a certificate are considered valid if the certificate has no key usage or if the key usage supports digital signatures or non repudiation. Default is false.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.SignatureValidationConfiguration.SkipSignerCheck
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies whether to check if an email was signed by the person that sent it. Default is false.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.SignatureValidationConfiguration.AddressComparisionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that specifies a way in which and signature addresses are compared. Default is .

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Tools.PartialMailJoiner
member.summary: Represents partial email () joiner.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Tools.PartialMailJoiner.IgnoreNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the Contant-Type's header field property should be ingored. Default is false.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Tools.PartialMailJoiner.IgnoreId
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if the Contant-Type's header id field should be ingored. Default is false.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.Tools.PartialMailJoiner.IgnoreFirstMessageHeaders
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating if first message headers should be copied to the resulting message. Default is false.
member.remarks: (1) All of the header fields from the initial enclosing entity (part one), except those that start with "Content-" and the specific header fields "Message-ID", "Encrypted", and "MIME-Version", must be copied, in order, to the new message. (2) Only those header fields in the enclosed message which start with "Content-" and "Message-ID", "Encrypted", and "MIME-Version" must be appended, in order, to the header fields of the new message. Any header fields in the enclosed message which do not start with "Content-" (except for "Message-ID", "Encrypted", and "MIME-Version") will be ignored. (3) All of the header fields from the second and any subsequent messages will be ignored.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.IsForward
member.summary: Gets the boolean value indicating if this message was forwarded.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.IsPartial
member.summary: Gets the boolean value indicating if this message was split (MIME document root is of type ).

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.PartialId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier to be used to match the parts together.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.From
member.summary: Gets the author(s) of this email message ('From' header). This collection can be modified. If it's empty, email message is NOT RFC 2822 compliant.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Sender
member.summary: Gets or sets mailbox of the agent responsible for the actual transmission of this email message ('Sender' header). If 'Sender' is null, it returns first item from collection.
member.remarks: 'Sender' is not required if property contains only one . 'Sender' property is needed when message is from more than one person ( contains more than one mailbox). In such case Sender provides information which mailbox is responsible for the actual transmission.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.SenderHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets mailbox of the agent responsible for the actual transmission of this email message ('Sender' header).
member.remarks: 'Sender' is not required if property contains only one . 'Sender' property is needed when message is from more than one person ( contains more than one mailbox). In such case Sender provides information which mailbox is responsible for the actual transmission.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ReplyTo
member.summary: Gets the address(es) to which the author of this email message suggests that replies be sent ('Reply-to' header). In this collection you can find which represents single mailbox, or which represents group of email addresses. This collection can be modified. May be empty.
member.remarks: The Reply-To value should not be used by any server. It is meant for client side use.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.To
member.summary: Gets the address(es) of the primary recipient(s) of this email message ('To' header). In this collection you can find which represents single mailbox, or which represents group of email addresses. This collection can be modified. May be empty.
member.remarks: You can use Linq's To.SelectMany(address => address.GetMailboxes()) to retrieve list.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Cc
member.summary: Gets the address(es) of others who are to receive this email message ('CC', Carbon Copy header), even tough the content of the message may not be directed at them. In this collection you can find which represent single mailbox, or which represents group of email addresses. This collection can be modified. May be empty.
member.remarks: You can use Linq's Cc.SelectMany(address => address.GetMailboxes()) to retrieve list.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Bcc
member.summary: Gets the address(es) of others who are to receive this email message ('BCC', Blind Carbon Copy header), even tough the content of the message may not be directed at them. In this collection you can find which represents single mailbox, or which represents group of email addresses. This collection can be modified. May be empty. BCC header is not rendered when method is used, however it is rendered when message is saved using method.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.EnvelopeTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the recipient taken from the SMTP envelope (SMTP "RCTP FROM").
member.remarks: If the recipient in the SMTP envelope ("RCTP TO") is not included in the CC list, some mail servers add this header as an aid to clients which would otherwise not be able to display the envelope recipients.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.RcptTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the recipient taken from the SMTP envelope (SMTP "RCTP FROM").
member.remarks: If the recipient in the SMTP envelope ("RCTP TO") is not included in the CC list, some mail servers add this header as an aid to clients which would otherwise not be able to display the envelope recipients.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.XRcptTo
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the recipient taken from the SMTP envelope (SMTP "RCTP FROM").
member.remarks: If the recipient in the SMTP envelope ("RCTP TO") is not included in the CC list, some mail servers add this header as an aid to clients which would otherwise not be able to display the envelope recipients.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.EnvelopeFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the sender taken from the SMTP envelope (SMTP "MAIL FROM").
member.remarks: If the sender in the SMTP envelope ("MAIL FROM") is not the same as the senders in the "From" or "Sender" RFC 2822 header fields, some mail servers add this header as an aid to clients which would otherwise not be able to display the envelope sender.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.XEnvelopeFrom
member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the sender taken from the SMTP envelope (SMTP "MAIL FROM").
member.remarks: If the sender in the SMTP envelope ("MAIL FROM") is not the same as the senders in the "From" or "Sender" RFC 2822 header fields, some mail servers add this header as an aid to clients which would otherwise not be able to display the envelope sender.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.NotificationTo
member.summary: Gets the disposition notifications addresses ('Disposition-Notification-To' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ReturnReceiptTo
member.summary: Gets return receipt addresses ('Return-Receipt-To' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.XConfirmReadingTo
member.summary: Gets confirm reading addresses ('X-Confirm-Reading-To' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ReturnPath
member.summary: Gets or sets return path address ('Return-Path' header). Does not include brackets (< and >).
member.remarks: All bounces that occur during the SMTP session should go back to the Return-Path value. The recipient's mail server is supposed to add a Return-Path header to the top of the email. If Return-Path header already exists in the email, then that header should be replaced by the recipient's mail server.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the send date of this email message ('Date' header). May be null in case of parsing error.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ListArchive

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ListHelp
member.summary: Gets URL list for mailing list information ('List-Help' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.summary: Gets or sets mailing list identifier ('List-Id' header).May be null.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ListOwner

member.summary: Gets URL list for mailing list posting ('List-Post' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ListSubscribe
member.summary: Gets URL list for mailing list subscription ('List-Subscribe' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.ListUnsubscribe
member.summary: Gets list of URLs ("http://www.example.com/unsubscribe") or emails ("mailto:unsubscribe@lexample.com") for mailing list unsubscription ('List-Unsubscribe' header). This collection can be modified. May be empty.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Importance
member.summary: Gets or sets the importance of this email message ('Importance' header). Consider using as it also checks and properties.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of this email message ('Priority' header). Consider using as it also checks and properties.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.XPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets the X-Priority of this email message ('X-Priority' header) (Outlook specific). Value ranges from "1" to "5" where "1" is the highest priority, "3" is normal, and "5" is the lowest priority. Consider using as it also checks and properties.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the sensitivity of this email message ('Sensitivity' header)

member.summary: Gets the list of all 'received' headers added to this email message.

member.summary: Gets or sets the 'X-Msg2Mime-Client-Submit-Time' value. It represents PR_CLIENT_SUBMIT_TIME. May be null.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Rtf
member.summary: Gets RTF version of this email message. RTF may be extracted from a TNEF attachment (winmail.dat) a proprietary e-mail attachment format used by Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Exchange Server.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.Text

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.TextData
member.summary: Gets the object representing 'text/plain' body of this email message. May be null if no text/plain data is present. You may use as a shortcut to retrieve plain text.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.HtmlData
member.summary: Gets the object representing 'text/html' body of this email message. May be null if no HTML data is present. You may use as a shortcut to retrieve HTML text.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.RtfData
member.summary: Gets the object representing 'text/rtf' or 'application/rtf' body of this email message. May be null if no RTF data is present. You may use as a shortcut to retrieve RTF text.
member.remarks: This object may be created by TNEF to MIME parser from a TNEF attachment (winmail.dat) a proprietary e-mail attachment format used by Microsoft Outlook and Microsoft Exchange Server.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.HtmlDataString

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.TextDataString

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.IsRtf
member.summary: Returns true if body of this email message is specified in RTF format. You can use property to access RTF version of the body.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.IsHtml

member.name: M:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.CheckSignature(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Verifies the digital signatures on the signed CMS/PKCS #7 email message and, optionally, validates the signers' certificates. Checks also if the content was signed by the person that sent it.
member.param: A System.Boolean value that specifies whether only the digital signatures are verified without the signers' certificates being validated. If is true, only the digital signatures are verified. If it is false, the digital signatures are verified, the signers' certificates are validated, and the purposes of the certificates are validated. The purposes of a certificate are considered valid if the certificate has no key usage or if the key usage supports digital signatures or non repudiation.

member.name: M:Limilabs.Mail.IMail.CheckSignature(Limilabs.Mail.SignatureValidationConfiguration)
member.summary: Verifies the digital signatures on the signed CMS/PKCS #7 email message and, optionally, validates the signers' certificates. Checks also if the content was signed by the person that sent it.

member.returns: True if signature was valid, otherwise.

member.summary: Verifies the DKIM (DomainKeys Identified Mail) digital signature on this message.
member.param: RSA class containing public key used for signature validation.
member.returns: True if signature was valid, otherwise.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.Bcc
member.summary: Gets the address(es) of others who are to receive this email message ('BCC', Blind Carbon Copy header), even tough the content of the message may not be directed at them. You can use to represent single mailbox, or to represent group of email addresses. BCC header is not rendered when method is used, however it is rendered when message is saved using method.

member.summary: Gets or sets the address of the sender taken from the SMTP envelope (SMTP "MAIL FROM").

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.Date

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.Importance
member.summary: Gets or sets the importance of a email message ('Importance' header). Consider using or methods instead of setting this field.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets the priority of a email message ('Priority' header). Consider using or methods instead of setting this field.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.XPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets the X-Priority of this email message ('X-Priority' header) (Outlook specific). Value ranges from "1" to "5" where "1" is the highest priority, "3" is normal, and "5" is the lowest priority. Consider using or methods instead of setting this field.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.Sensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the sensitivity of a email message ('Sensitivity' header).

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.SetDefaults
member.summary: Gets or set the value indicating whether default values (, , ) should be set. Default is true.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.SMIMEConfiguration
member.summary: Gets or sets S/MIME decrypt configuration (automatic decryption, certificates used for decryption).

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.ProcessTnefAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if TNEF attachments (winmail.dat) should be processed. TNEF processing extracts attachments and RTF data from TNEF file and removes TNEF from attachments collections afterwards. Default is true.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.ProcessUueAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if inline UUE attachments should be extracted. Default is true.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.RemoveInlinedUue
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if text representation of inline UUE attachments should be removed from . Default is false. This property has no affect if is set to false.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.ProcessBinHexAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if file stored in BinHex attachments () should be extracted. Default is true.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.ProcessAppleAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if files stored in AppleSingle () and AppleDouble () entities should be extracted. Default is true.

member.name: P:Limilabs.Mail.MailBuilder.CreatePlainTextAutomatically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if plain text version of a body is extracted from HTML when ot property is set. Default is true.

member.name: T:Limilabs.Mail.Templates.Template
member.summary: Represents the template that can be used to create email messages.
member.remarks:
string text = Template .LoadFromFile("template.txt") .DataFrom(reportData) .Render();
Template sample:
Hi [FirstName] [LastName],
On [PurchaseDate:yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm] you purchased following items: [foreach OrderItems] - [Id] [Name] [Price] [end] \[ escaped square brackets \]
